question: The "Aegean Islands" are under the administrative control of which two countries?
explanation: The Aegean Islands are the group of islands in the Aegean Sea, with mainland Greece to the west and north and Turkey to the east; the island of Crete delimits the sea to the south, those of Rhodes, Karpathos and Kasos to the southeast. The vast majority of the Aegean Islands belong to Greece. There are only sizable possessions of Turkey under Turkish sovereignty.
